page.title: 03Childs Ercall school
page.content: { {The school is over 160 years old .}It could have been a barn because the roof is very high so wheat could have stored in it. The windows are high and there are bricked in parts that could have been doors high in the walls for the wheat to be loaded into the barn. {On the 26 of July 1921 the Corbets {sold the school to the churchwardens {of the parish of Childs Ercall in the {county of Salop.}Class one is made of wood it is a demountable building and was built about tewnty years ago when there were 100 children in the school but there are only 35 now.The number of children dropped there are now 22 infants and 13 juniors but there are many babys being born in the village so we hope the number of childen in school will go up over the next few years.
